alert.note: Alert for Jones; Shackelford; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 11 at 5:41PM CDT until June 12 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CALLAHAN...SOUTHEASTERN JONES...SOUTHWESTERN SHACKELFORD AND NORTHEASTERN TAYLOR COUNTIES... At 541 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Wylie, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Wylie around 550 PM CDT. Dudley around 615 PM CDT. Potosi around 620 PM CDT. Eula around 635 PM CDT. Hamby around 640 PM CDT. Abilene, Clyde, Baird and Nugent around 645 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Impact, Lake Fort Phantom Hill, Us-283 Near The Callahan- Shackelford County Line and Kirby Lake. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 279 and 310. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
